comments_since_last_sample.body: Constantly watched quiet's tiddies bounce in MGS5

Playing chess with my uncle and he was a few moves from check mate. I threw the board up, picked up the nearby fire poker and smashed him over the head. I drove his body it to the local swamp and pushed it in. Using his phone I text my aunt that he was leaving her for a younger women then destroyed the phone. His body was found six months later, but nobody suspected me.
I spoke at his funeral saying how sad it was that we'd never get to play chess again, and told everyone that I wish I hadn't won so hard on our last game.
Might be when I killed dogs intentionally in Watch dogs 2
Im a grown ass man, and my Mother came to visit me when i was playing GTAV. So i said Ma, look: Hits a dog with a hammer in the street
I did some unspeakable things in RDR2.
You know how many times I've sacrificed a yoshi to make a jump?

Epic Battle Fantasy 5 has a sidequest to capture a Friend Dog enemy (that only does support moves and sometimes even heals YOU), and give it to a girl. Some time later I see the girl with her dog, and I think "Ooh, I wonder if the dog will bark if I interact with it". Cause, y'know, pigs will squeal and goats and sheep will bleat if you do.

NOPE IT STARTS A FIGHT. And I killed the dog, without clicking a button, because in Epic Battle Fantasy, upgraded equipment can trigger attacks automatically. 

Naturally, I reset the game and threw away an hour of progress just to be sure this girl still had her dog, because that's how I am.
Finished Red Dead Redemption 2 even though I hated it.
